conbody.p: Each modularized system will be visualized in a so-called module tree. The module tree is shown within the eclipse Project explorer as a sub-element of a BundleMaker project. The root of the module tree is the modularized system.

section.title: Flat vs. hierarchical tree structure
section.p: It is possible to create different module trees for a (transformed) system. E.g. the user must be able to choose if packages and/or groups are shown flat or hierarchical:

section.title: Resources and types
section.p:
It also must be possible to determine if resources and/or types are shown. At least the following selections must be available:
Source resources with contained types: In this scenario the module tree contains all source resources and the types that are contained in the source resources.
Source resources without contained types: In this scenarion the module tree contains all the source resources, but the contained types are not shown.
Binary resources with contained types: In this scenario the module tree contains all the binary resources and the types that are contained in the binary resources.
Binary resources without contained types: In this scenarion the module tree contains all the binary resources, but the contained types are not shown.
Types only (no resources): In this scenarion all types (from source and binary resources) are shown, but the resources are not shown.

section.title: Choosing the module tree style
section.p:
To choose the module tree style the user can select several options from a "Module Presentation" submenu in the Project Explorer view. The "Module Presentation" submenu contains the following options:
Flat / Hierarchical: The user can choose if groups and packages are shown flat or hierarchical.
Show Resources / Show Types: The user can choose whether resources or types or both are shown in the module tree. At least one option must be selected.
Source Resources / Binary Resources: If resources are shown in the module tree, the user can select whether source resource or binary resources should be displayed.
